net.cloud.gfx.focus

Interface Focusable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DecoratorElement, Element
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractButton, AbstractDecoratorElement, AbstractElement, AbstractModalDialog, Button, CenteredText, Checkbox, ConfirmationDialog, DraggableElement, FramedElement, HorizontalView, HorizontalView.HorizontalViewElement, ImageButton, InputDialog, Interface, LoginInterface, MessageDialog, PasswordField, PriorityContainer, QuasiRoot, RadioButton, ReferenceText, ScrollView, ScrollView.Scrollbar, SelectableButton, Sprite, SpriteTestInterface, TestElement, TestModalDialog, Text, TextArea, TextField, TiledSprite, VerticalView, VerticalView.VerticalViewElement

    public interface Focusable
    Defines an object which can hold focus in the system. A focusable object can be linked to other focusable objects to form a chain of sorts. This way, focus can be transferred from one to the next. A focusable object supports checking for whether or not it has focus, and for dealing with typed key events. (Since key events are delivered to an object with focus)
    See Also:
    FocusHandler, FocusController

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void focusGained()
      Called when this Focusable has gained focus.
      void focusLost()
      Called when this FocusHandler no longer has focus.
      FocusHandler getFocusHandler()
      Obtain the FocusHandler underlying this Focusable object.
      void keyTyped(char key)
      Tell this focusable object that it has received a key event.
      default void linkNextFocusable(Focusable current, Focusable next)
      Tell this object what the next focusable object in line should be.
      default void linkPreviousFocusable(Focusable current, Focusable previous)
      Tell the handler what the previous Focusable in line should be.
      default void unlink(Focusable current)
      Tell this Focusable that it should no longer be linked in a focus chain.

    • Method Detail

      • getFocusHandler

        FocusHandler getFocusHandler()
        Obtain the FocusHandler underlying this Focusable object. The handler will take care of tracking focus and and chain of focusable objects for changing focus. This should never be null. That would not be cool.
        Returns:
        The FocusHandler underlying this Focusable object

      • focusGained

        void focusGained()
        Called when this Focusable has gained focus. Should inform the focus handler that focus was gained, as well. The FocusHandler is still used to check if the Focusable currently has focus.

      • focusLost

        void focusLost()
        Called when this FocusHandler no longer has focus. (And previously did) Should inform the focus handler that focus was lost, as well. The FocusHandler is still used to check if the Focusable currently has focus.

      • keyTyped

        void keyTyped(char key)
        Tell this focusable object that it has received a key event. This is defined here since an object with focus is the object that key events are sent to. However, nothing needs to be done with this event from here. It can simply be discarded if desired.
        Parameters:
        key - The character which was typed

      • linkNextFocusable

        default void linkNextFocusable(Focusable current,
                               Focusable next)
        Tell this object what the next focusable object in line should be. This will connect them, so this object knows the next object and the given focusable knows this one is its previous. This is the method that should be used when constructing focus chains.
        Default behavior is FocusController.link(this, next);
        Parameters:
        current - The focusable object being linked to next
        next - The next Focusable in line

      • linkPreviousFocusable

        default void linkPreviousFocusable(Focusable current,
                                   Focusable previous)
        Tell the handler what the previous Focusable in line should be. This will connect them, so this Focusable knows the previous Focusable and the given Focusable knows this one is its next. This is the method that should be used when constructing focus chains.
        Default behavior is FocusController.link(previous, this);
        Parameters:
        current - The focusable object being linked to previous
        previous - The previous Focusable in line

      • unlink

        default void unlink(Focusable current)
        Tell this Focusable that it should no longer be linked in a focus chain. If there is a next and/or previous Focusable, they will then be joined to each other and this Focusable will no longer be within a focus chain.
        Default behavior is FocusController.unlink(getFocusHandler().getPrevious(), this, getFocusHandler().getNext());
        Parameters:
        current - The focusable object whose links are being severed
